summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to UBS Bank USA, dated September 25, 2019, commanding the production of extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and several associated entities. The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking and related offenses, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as an individual whose financial records are being subpoenaed, along with several entities associated with her.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the grand jury investigation for which Maxwell's financial records are being subpoenaed.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY issues a grand jury subpoena to UBS Bank USA for financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and associated entities.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands UBS Bank USA to appear before the grand jury to produce records, though personal appearance is waived if records are produced to the FBI by this date.

locations: UBS Bank USA, 1000 Harbor Blvd 8th Floor, Weehawken, NJ 07086
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of a federal grand jury investigation into suspected felonies, specifically citing violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The subpoena targets extensive financial records for Ghislaine Maxwell and the entities TERRAMAR PROJECT INC., ELLMAX LLC, MAX FOUNDATION, and MAX HOTEL SERVICES CORP.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests that UBS Bank USA not disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.

The requested records are comprehensive, including signature cards, wire transfers, safe deposit records, credit card statements, loan applications, corporate documents, and online banking information.
The document indicates the investigation was active and seeking detailed financial evidence as of September 2019, prior to Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest in July 2020.
